title: Dense essence mine

properties.name: description
properties.value: The dense essence mine is located north-east of Arceuus. The mine contains two dense runestones, where players can mine dense essence blocks, which are then used on the Dark Altar to create dark essence blocks. It is not possible to get a rock golem pet from mining here.[1]

content:
Dense essence mine
Released7 January 2016 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationArceuus (Great Kourend)
InhabitantsCorporeal spirits
Map
Advanced data
Typemine

The dense essence mine is located north-east of Arceuus. The mine contains two dense runestones, where players can mine dense essence blocks, which are then used on the Dark Altar to create dark essence blocks. It is not possible to get a rock golem pet from mining here.[1]

Players can donate dense essence blocks to Clerris in return for Arceuus favour.

In order to use this mine, players require at least 25% Arceuus favour in addition to 38 Mining and 38 Crafting. A pickaxe and chisel in the player's inventory is required to mine the dense runestone, granting 12 Mining and 8 Crafting experience per block mined.

After completion of the medium tasks in the Kourend & Kebos Diary, players have a chance to mine two dense essence blocks at once. No additional experience is awarded for the extra block.

While only 38 Mining is required to mine the essence, a higher Mining level is slightly helpful, as the essence stone depletes less frequently with a higher Mining level.[2] At level 38 Mining there is a 85% chance to not deplete the dense runestone when successfully mining a dense essence block, increasing to 90% at level 99.[3]

In order to use the shortcuts, you need to have 73 Agility for the western rock scramble, 69 for the northern scramble and 52 for the eastern scramble.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 4 August 2016. (Archived from the original on 13 April 2020.) Mod Ash: "Nope."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 13 March 2018. (Archived from the original on 25 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Yes, slightly."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 31 October 2018. (Archived from the original on 25 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "82% -> 90% from 1 to 99"
